Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals that live in the same habitat as the fish.
The student can draw and label the habitat where the fish lives, such as a lake, river, or ocean.
The student can draw and label the resources that the fish and other living things in the habitat need, like water and plants.
The student can show the relationships between the fish and the resources it needs to survive, like water to swim in.
The student can illustrate how the habitat provides the necessary resources for the fish and other living things.
The student can represent how the fish and its habitat are part of a system where parts work together to meet the needs of living things.
